title: Academic Visual Journaling Practices to Strengthen Visual Literacy in Higher Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic proficiency in digital tools and foundational knowledge of social sciences
context.additional_context: Development of visual communication competencies in social contexts for current practitioners.

learning_goals: Learners can produce academic visual journals using smartphones and execute the text-to-image transmediation process.
Learners can explain the relationship between creativity, self-reflection, and deepened content understanding through visual journaling.
Learners can apply at least three visual representation techniques (photo collage, sketch notes, infographics) to real-world cases.

resources: Mobile-Friendly Digital Journaling App (e.g., Canva, Notability)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
